metadata.dc:description: In a 53-year-old woman a percutaneous liver biopsy was performed with tru-cut to study persistent hypertransaminasemia. The patient did not present extrahepatic cholestasis. Immediately after biopsy the patient had a picture of biliary peritonitis that evolved favorably with conservative medical treatment, including hemodynamic resuscitation, antibiotic therapy, analgesic treatment and monitoring by the resuscitation service. A review is made of the literature on this complication of liver biopsy and treatment is discussed.
metadata.dc:title: Peritonitis biliar postbiopsia hepática: evolución favorable con tratamiento médico conservador.
[Biliary peritonitis after hepatic biopsy: favorable course with conservative medical treatment].
